p: Initial concern regarding RAAS blockers during the COVID-19 pandemic impelled international societies to issue positions advocating the importance of RAAS therapy maintenance in patients with formal indication during the pandemic. Current evidence indicates that hypertension per se might be a risk factor associated with a higher mortality and worse outcomes in patients with COVID-19, particularly patients with uncontrolled hypertension, and that controlled hypertension specifically with RAAS blocker therapy might be associated with more favorable outcomes.
